summary: This course is the original Cisco course, part of the Cisco IT Academy program, offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University. The course provides comprehensive training in networking concepts and skills, including configuring and verifying IPv4 and IPv6 addressing, VLANs, interswitch connectivity, Layer 2/Layer 3 EtherChannel, static routing, OSPFv2, NAT, NTP, DHCP, and SSH. It also covers network security concepts, such as threats, vulnerabilities, mitigation techniques, and security program elements like user awareness and physical access control. The course is hybrid, allowing students to attend classes either on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan or via Zoom. It consists of 17 sessions (85 academic hours) and will begin on January 3, 2025, with classes held on Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00. The course is designed to prepare students for the highly sought-after IT certification in the field of networking.

COURSE NAME: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)

COURSE OVERVIEW: This is the original Cisco course, part of the Cisco IT Academy program, offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University. The course provides comprehensive training to achieve the sought-after IT certification in networking.

COURSE LEADERSHIP: Skip (No specific leadership details provided).

PREREQUISITES: Skip (No prerequisites mentioned).

CERTIFICATIONS: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA).

COURSE SCHEDULE:
- Start Date: 03.01.2025.
- Duration: 17 sessions.
- Academic Hours: 85 hours.
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00.

LEARNING FORMAT:
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on the participant's choice.

TUITION AND FEES: Skip (No tuition or fee details provided).

COURSE TOPICS:
- Explain the role and function of network components.
- Describe characteristics of network topology architectures.
- Compare physical interface and cabling types.
- Configure and verify IPv4 addressing and subnetting.
- Configure and verify IPv6 addressing and prefix.
- Describe wireless principles.
- Configure and verify VLANs (normal range) spanning multiple switches.
- Configure and verify interswitch connectivity.
- Configure and verify Layer 2 discovery protocols.
- Configure and verify Layer 2/Layer 3 EtherChannel (LACP).
- Describe AP and WLC management access connections.
- Interpret the components of the routing table.
- Configure and verify IPv4 and IPv6 static routing.
- Configure and verify single area OSPFv2.
- Configure and verify inside source NAT using static and pools.
- Configure and verify NTP operating in a client and server mode.
- Configure and verify DHCP client and relay.
- Configure network devices for remote access using SSH.
- Define key security concepts, including threats, vulnerabilities, exploits, and mitigation techniques.
- Describe security program elements, such as user awareness and physical access control.
- Configure device access control using local passwords.
- Describe security password policy elements.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION:
- To schedule an admission interview and registration, contact: 052-5886002.
- Email: esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION:
- The course is part of the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University.
- The program is supported by the dedicated programs division of Bar-Ilan University.
- Classes are held at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan.

ADDITIONAL NOTES:
- The course is hybrid, allowing flexibility for participants to choose between in-person and online learning options.
